meanings.sent1: The sporogenous plant released tiny spores into the air.
meanings.sent2: The sporogenous fungi spread spores to reproduce.
meanings.sent3: The sporogenous moss seemed to be playing a spore-filled game of tag.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was sporogenous, giving birth to new ideas like spores in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The sporogenous dandelion scattered its spores in all directions, creating a beautiful spectacle.

meanings.sent1: The sporogenous growth on the tree trunk was a result of spores settling there.
meanings.sent2: The sporogenous bacteria evolved from spores present in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The sporogenous mold seemed to be having a spore party on the old bread slice.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were sporogenous, emerging from tiny spores of inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The sporogenous ferns sprouted from spores, painting the forest floor with green life.
